result.execSummary:
The defendant Axel R. Conrad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent.  No contact with K.H.  17 days credit if revoked.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Axel R. Conrad in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Defendant Axel R. Conrad in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.   Atty Frank agrees and then makes statement on DE's behalf.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

13CM360
9 months jail w/huber concurrent to 14CF56 w/huber privileges consecutive to any other sentence to commence FORTHWITH
Unpaid costs/surcharges to be taken from huber account and then converted to civil judgment upon release
100 days credit to be applied


14CF56
3 months jail concurrent to 13CM360 sentence w/huber privileges but consecutive to any other sentence
Unpaid costs/surcharges to be taken from huber account and then converted to civil judgment upon release
17 days credt to be applied


15CF54 and 15CF56...Atty Calkins states he will speak to the judicial assistant about having those set out for further dates.  Bond continues in both matters.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 04-24-2015 03:00 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 04-08-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Axel R. Conrad in court with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney ORourke gives status.  Amended charge:  943.20(1)(a).   Attorney ORourke gives agreement.  State agrees, moves to amend.  Court amends.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Victim notification met.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
12 months Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
No contact w/ K.H.
$243.00 costs & $200.00 surcharge and $10.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
17 days credit if revoked.
Paperwork handed in court.
$500 cash bond w/conditions changed to $500 Sig bond w/same conditions

Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Return date on May 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Axel R. Conrad appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500 Cash bail.  Atty. ORourke requests signature bond and on a hold.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/K.H. or T.M. or Kalahari Resort or C.C.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
